conclusion: The problem involves predicting which bottom container (E, F, or G) liquid will flow into after passing through baffles.

The setup includes colored containers at the top (A, B, C, D) that release liquids, colored bars/baffles in the middle area that redirect the flow, and house-shaped containers at the bottom (E, F, G) that collect liquids.
The solution will analyze how the liquid flows from each top container to predict which bottom container it will end up in.
Liquid from container A (mint green) flows down in the 2nd and 3rd images.
Liquid from A encounters the gray baffle and gets redirected leftward.
Liquid from A continues flowing along the green baffle and then the pink baffle.
Following its path, liquid from A flows down along the left side.
Liquid from A collects in container E (the red house-shaped container on the far left).
Liquid from container B (orange) flows straight down in the 2nd and 3rd images.
Liquid from B hits the gray baffle and appears to flow along it.
Liquid from B encounters the yellow liquid stream.
Following its path in the 3rd image, the combined orange/yellow flow appears to flow toward the black baffle.
The combined orange/yellow flow collects in container F (the gray house-shaped container).
Liquid from container C (yellow) flows straight down.
In the 3rd image, yellow liquid flows onto the black baffle.
From the black baffle, yellow liquid pools and flows into container F (the gray house-shaped container).
Liquid from container D (pink) flows straight down from the top right.
In the 2nd and 3rd images, pink liquid forms a dotted/broken stream on the right side.
Pink liquid doesn't appear to hit any baffles directly.
Following its straight path down, pink liquid collects in container G (the orange/yellow house-shaped container on the right).
Final Answer: Liquid from A → E, Liquid from B → F, Liquid from C → F, Liquid from D → G.
